com.ustrzycki.games

Class TicTacToeEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ustrzycki.games.TicTacToeEngine

  • public class TicTacToeEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    The TicTacToeEngine class implements the logic of a tic tac toe game on a 3 by 3 board. It should be used with other classes which will display the game on a console or GUI.

    The TicTacToeEngine class includes methods placing X or O in a square, checking if a square is empty, checking if a game is won, returning useful string messages and others. Some methods have been developed to work with boards larger than a 3 by 3 board.

    Since:
    2015-09-24
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Dariusz Ustrzycki

      • setXorOinSquare

        public void setXorOinSquare(int squareNumber)
        Places O or X in a given square. The method works also for boards larger than a 3 by 3 board.
        Parameters:
        squareNumber - the number of the square where X or O should be placed

      • isSquareEmpty

        public boolean isSquareEmpty(int squareNumber)
        Checks if a given square is empty (i.e. without X or O) The method also works for boards larger than a 3 by 3 board.
        Parameters:
        squareNumber - the number of the square to check
        Returns:
        returns true if the given square is not occupied by X or O

      • isTheGameWon

        public boolean isTheGameWon()
        Checks if the game is won.
        Returns:
        true if the game is won, false otherwise
